content:
Creating a Facebook event and sending individual texts is a great way to cover all your bases.

As for the timeline, three weeks is a good amount of time to plan and prepare for a game night. Here's a rough outline to help you stay on track:

**Week 1:**

* Create the Facebook event and send out invitations to your friends on Facebook.
* Send individual texts to those who aren't on Facebook.
* Start thinking about the games you want to play and make a rough list.
* Consider the snacks and drinks you'll provide.

**Week 2:**

* Finalize the game selection and make sure you have all the necessary materials (e.g., boards, cards, pieces).
* Plan the snacks and drinks in more detail, considering any dietary restrictions.
* Send out a reminder to your guests, and ask them to RSVP by a certain date.

**Week 3:**

* Confirm the final headcount and make any necessary adjustments to snacks and drinks.
* Prepare your home for the game night (e.g., clean, set up tables, decorate).
* Send out a final reminder to your guests, including any important details (e.g., parking, arrival time).

With this rough outline, you should be well-prepared for a fun and successful game night. Remember to relax and be flexible – things might not go exactly as planned, but that's all part of the fun!

One more thing to consider: you might want to have a backup plan in case some games don't work out or if you need to make last-minute changes. Having a few extra games or activities up your sleeve can help ensure that everyone has a great time.
